sn13.9:1.2: “Mendicants, suppose a person was to place seven pebbles the size of mustard seeds on the Himalayas, the king of mountains.
sn13.9:1.4: Which is more: the seven pebbles the size of mustard seeds, or the Himalayas, the king of mountains?”
sn13.9:2.1: “Sir, the Himalayas, the king of mountains, is certainly more.
sn13.9:2.2: The seven pebbles the size of mustard seeds are tiny.
sn13.9:2.3: Compared to the Himalayas, it’s not nearly a hundredth, a thousandth, or a hundred thousandth part.”
sn13.9:2.4: “In the same way, for a noble disciple, the suffering that’s over and done with is more …”
